snippet: On May 3, 1971, police clashed with anti-war protesters who called themselves "the Mayday Tribe," and had staged three days of demonstrations in Washington, D.C., aimed at shutting down the nation's capital.
abstract: On May 3, 1971, police clashed with anti-war protesters who called themselves "the Mayday Tribe," and had staged three days of demonstrations in Washington, D.C., aimed at shutting down the nation's capital.

headline.main: May 3, 1971 | Mayday Tribe Holds Antiwar Demonstration
